items.title: Indian Oil to supply LNG to NTPC’s upcoming 50 MW power plant in Andaman & Nicobar
items.description: India’s largest power major NTPC is in the process of acquiring land for the proposed plant. The 50 megawatt (MW) gas-based power plant in Andaman & Nicobar is expected to be commissioned by 2027-28, sources told Moneycontrol.

items.title: MakeMyTrip seeks over $2 billion in shares, convertible sale
items.description: MakeMyTrip is offering 14 million new shares, and is also seeking to raise $1.25 billion from the sale of zero-coupon convertible bonds, according to a statement Monday

items.title: Steel Secretary says FY26 imports will be half of last year, helped by safeguard duty
items.description: At a time when global growth has been wobbly, India has emerged as a bright spot, especially in consumption of steel, Secretary Poundrik said. The domestic consumption - at a per capita of 104 kilogram - is expected to rise significantly to Rs 155-160 kg by 2030, he said.

items.title: Is the cigarette major still a value play?
items.description: A possible taxation shock could create near-term demand headwinds

items.title: Chart of the Day: How Sun Pharma outperformed Indian market under the incoming MD
items.description: Kirti Ganorkar will succeed founder Dilip Shanghvi as managing director (MD) of the company

items.title: Tata Play deepens advertising innovation with addressable ads in partnership with ZEEL
items.description: The addressable TV advertising technology which was launched by Tata Play in 2023 enables advertisers to selectively segment TV audiences and serve different ads to different households, even if they are watching the same content.

items.title: Zee Board approves promoter stake hike to 18.39% through warrants issue
items.description: R. Gopalan, Chairman, ZEE Entertainment Enterprises said that the Board has deliberated upon the various alternatives discussed with J.P. Morgan and has conducted a thorough evaluation of the company’s growth plans.

items.title: Biocon opens QIP offering, sets floor price at Rs 340.20 per share
items.description: Biocon has a net debt of around $1.2 billion, which excludes structured instruments.

items.title: Oberoi Group expands green footprint across its hotel network
items.description: The group also said that it is expanding its reliance on renewable energy—solar, wind, and hydroelectric power

items.title: Siemens’ Sunil Mathur is confident of a private capex pick-up
items.description: Factories are running at 75-80 percent of their capacity in several sectors, levels at which capex plans take shape. But a string of geopolitical conflicts and the resulting uncertainty has made them cautious, says the company's MD & CEO
